message.content:
cs.CR, cs.NI, cs.DC, cs.SE, cs.SI 

This paper discusses the vulnerability of the Internet and the security mechanisms in the inter-domain routing protocol BGP, which are topics related to computer security (cs.CR) and network infrastructure (cs.NI). The paper also discusses the potential malicious intentions behind hijacking incidents, which falls under the category of distributed, parallel, and cluster computing (cs.DC) and software engineering (cs.SE). Finally, the paper proposes a solution to prevent hijacking incidents by monitoring domain name expiration, which is related to social and information networks (cs.SI).
